snippet: Party strategists and voters fear a protracted nomination fight that could end with a damaged standard-bearer facing a more unified left.

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer, Maggie Haberman, Thomas Kaplan and Jonathan Martin contributed reporting.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and TRIP GABRIEL

abstract: Republican presidential field remains tumultuous, as contenders prepare for long nomination fight that strategists fear could end with weakened standard-bearer; Donald J Trump has lost his lead in Iowa to Ben Carson, and Jeb Bush has cut salaries, fired consultants and laid off or reassigned many campaign workers in effort to win support from moderates.
lead_paragraph: Party strategists and voters fear a protracted nomination fight that could end with a damaged standard-bearer facing a more unified left.

headline.print_headline: Bush Cuts Costs, Carson Eclipses Trump in Iowa and G.O.P. Frets
headline.main: Bush Cuts Costs, Carson Eclipses Trump in Iowa and G.O.P. Frets
